column4: hi all, i'm having an issue with grub2: it's not modifying my boot list. i think it may have to do with starting out on lmde and then adding ubuntu afterwards?
make sure the os-prober is installed
thanks Fyodorovna i'll check that now
in the terminal sudo apt-get install os-prober
thanks Fyodorovna it's already installed
so do you have more then one OS on the computer?
yes, originally it was dual-boot with linux mint debian edition and doze. then i added ubuntu as well
ubuuntu was installed last?
yes
somehow all of the right kernel entries show up in the grub.cfg file but not in the list at boot
what is missing in the boot menu?
the new ubuntu kernels
everything shows up properly in grub customizer as well
did yoiu install those or did it come in a update upgrade
you*
came in the update upgrade
so is ubuntu or debian controlling the boot?
3.0-15 and 16 are installed but 12 is the last showing. i thought ubuntu was but i'm assuming it must be debian. how to check?
sorry it's been so long since i put debian on, i'm foggy on the details of that install. probably that bootloader is on the mbr and ubuntu is on the partition?
the last install is generally the controlling boot unless it did not load the mbr. Have you run a uopdate-grub in debian, if it is running grub3 you need to run it there.
grub 2*
ah ok, i'll just boot into debian again for that. i ran it on ubuntu, but should've thought of that. will try it now. many thanks!
